00085 int main(int argc, char **argv){
00086 //load_config_file("MODULES.txt");
00087 
00088   // Parse the command line
00089   ARGUMENTS arguments;
00090   int ret = analyze_command_line (argc, argv,arguments);
00091   if(ret!=0) return ret;
00092   printf("Starting event");
00093 
00094   
00095   //EventNavigator& en = EventNavigator::Instance();
00096   //std::cout << "\n " << "###" << en.ConnectInput(arguments.infile) <<std::endl;
00097   //en.ConnectOutputFile("demo.root");
00098   //en.CopyTree();
00099   //return 0;
00100 
00101   // Open the input tree file
00102   
00103   // Make an initial call to singleton objects that are very likely to be called at some point.
00104   ret = PrepareSingletonObjects(arguments);
00105   if(ret!=0) {
00106      std::cout<<"Error: Problem creating a singleton object..."<<std::endl;
00107      return ret;
00108   }
00109 
00110   // Now that we've loaded the TSetupData for this run check if there are any
00111   // suggested replacements for the wiremap data
00112   //CheckSetupData(s_data, arguments.correction_file);
00113 
00114   //Event Tree
00115   TTree* eventTree = GetTree(gInFile,"EventTree");
00116   if(!eventTree) return 1;
00117   eventTree->SetBranchAddress("Event",&g_event);
00118 
00119   // Let's open the output file for analysis data, histograms and so on.
00120   TFile *fileOut = new TFile(arguments.outfile, "RECREATE");
00121   if(!fileOut->IsOpen()){
00122     printf("Could not open ROOT output file %s\n", arguments.outfile);
00123     return 1;
00124   }
00125   fileOut->cd();
00126 
00127   // Now let's setup all the analysis modules we want
00128   // NOTE: This has to be done after the output file was opened else the
00129   // modules wont have a directory to store things to.
00130   ret= modules::navigator::Instance()->LoadConfigFile(arguments.mod_file);
00131   if(ret!=0) {
00132      printf("Problem setting up analysis modules.\n");
00133      return ret;
00134   }
00135   
00136   // Setup the analysed pulse map to store / read in the pulses
00137   ret = PrepareAnalysedPulseMap(fileOut);
00138   if(ret!=0) {
00139      printf("Problem preparing analysed pulse map.");
00140      return ret;
00141   }
00142 
00143   // Finally let's do the main loop
00144   fileOut->cd();
00145   Main_event_loop(eventTree,arguments);
00146 
00147   // and finish up
00148   fileOut->cd();
00149   gAnalysedPulseTree->Write();
00150   fileOut->Write();
00151   fileOut->Close();
00152   gInFile->Close();
00153 
00154   return 0;
00155 }
00156 
00157 Int_t Main_event_loop(TTree* dataTree,ARGUMENTS& arguments){
00158 /*************************************************************************\
00159 | Loop over tree entries and call histogramming modules.                  |
00160 \*************************************************************************/
00161   Long64_t nentries = dataTree->GetEntriesFast();
00162   printf("There are %d entries\n",(int)nentries);
00163   std::cout<<"Processing file, which may take a while. "
00164      "Have patience young padawan.."<<std::endl;
00165 
00166   //set up the input data
00167   if (g_event){
00168     g_event->Clear("C");
00169     dataTree->SetBranchAddress("Event",&g_event);
00170   }
00171 
00172   // How many entries should we loop over?
00173   Long64_t start = 0;
00174   Long64_t stop = nentries;
00175   if(arguments.stop>0){
00176     if(arguments.start>0)
00177       start = (Long64_t)(arguments.start-1);
00178     if((Long64_t)arguments.stop < nentries)
00179       stop = (Long64_t)arguments.stop;
00180   }
00181   else if((Long64_t)arguments.start < nentries && arguments.start > 0){
00182     stop = (Long64_t)arguments.start;
00183   }
00184   
00185   //preprocess first event
00186   if (g_event){
00187     g_event->Clear();//"C");
00188     dataTree->SetBranchAddress("Event",&g_event);
00189   }
00190 
00191   // wind the file on to the first event
00192   dataTree->GetEntry(start);
00193 
00194   // Get the first and last module to run with
00195   modules::iterator first_module = modules::navigator::Instance()->Begin();
00196   modules::iterator last_module = modules::navigator::Instance()->End();
00197   modules::iterator it_mod;
00198 
00199   int q = 0;
00200   for (it_mod=first_module; it_mod != last_module; it_mod++) {
00201     q |= it_mod->second->BeforeFirstEntry(g_event, TSetupData::Instance());
00202   }
00203   if(q) {
00204     printf("Error while preprocessing first entry (%d)\n",(Int_t)start);
00205     return q;
00206   }
00207 
00208   q = 0;
00209   //process entries
00210   Long64_t jentry;
00211   gEntryNumber=&jentry;
00212   for ( jentry=start; jentry<stop;jentry++) {
00213     if(g_event){
00214       g_event->Clear();//"C");
00215       ClearGlobalData(g_event);
00216       dataTree->SetBranchAddress("Event",&g_event);
00217     }
00218     
00219     if (jentry%100 == 0) {
00220       printf("Completed %lld events out of %lld\n", jentry, stop);
00221     }
00222     // Let's get the next event
00223     dataTree->GetEntry(jentry);
00224 
00225     for (it_mod=first_module; it_mod != last_module; it_mod++) {
00226       q |= it_mod->second->ProcessGenericEntry(g_event,TSetupData::Instance());
00227       //if(q) break;
00228     }
00229     if(q){
00230       printf("q was non-zero when jentry was %lld\n",jentry);
00231       break;
00232     }
00233 
00234     gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper->SetMap(gAnalysedPulseMap);
00235     //gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper->ShowInfo();
00236     gAnalysedPulseTree->Fill();
00237   }
00238 
00239   //post-process on last entry
00240   q = 0;
00241   for (it_mod=first_module; it_mod != last_module; it_mod++) {
00242     q |= it_mod->second->AfterLastEntry(g_event,TSetupData::Instance());
00243   }
00244   if (q) {
00245      printf("Error during post-processing last entry (%lld)\n",(stop-1));
00246       return q;
00247   }
00248   
00249   printf("Finished processing data normally\n");
00250   return 0;
00251 }
00252 
00253 void ClearGlobalData(TGlobalData* data)
00254 {
00255   // We could put this into TGlobalData::Clear(), but we need
00256   // to be sure that's okay at the alcapana level. That is, if
00257   // Clear() deletes the TPulseIsland objects, but g_event doesn't
00258   // own the pulses, they would be deleted later. A solution is to
00259   // be sure that TGlobalData isn't called in alcapana, or ensure
00260   // that g_event owns the pulse islands at that level.
00261   StringPulseIslandMap::iterator mapIter;
00262   StringPulseIslandMap::iterator mapEnd = data->fPulseIslandToChannelMap.end();
00263   for(mapIter = data->fPulseIslandToChannelMap.begin(); mapIter != mapEnd; mapIter++) {
00264     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00265     std::vector<TPulseIsland*> pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00266     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00267       delete pulse_vector[i];
00268       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00269     }
00270     pulse_vector.clear();
00271   }
00272 
00273 
00274   for(StringAnalPulseMap::iterator mapIter=gAnalysedPulseMap.begin();
00275      mapIter != gAnalysedPulseMap.end(); mapIter++) {
00276 
00277     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00278     AnalysedPulseList pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00279     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00280       delete pulse_vector[i];
00281       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00282     }
00283     pulse_vector.clear();
00284   }
00285   gAnalysedPulseMap.clear();
00286 
00287   for(StringDetPulseMap::iterator mapIter = gDetectorPulseMap.begin(); mapIter != gDetectorPulseMap.end(); mapIter++) {
00288     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00289     std::vector<TDetectorPulse*> pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00290     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00291       delete pulse_vector[i];
00292       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00293     }
00294     pulse_vector.clear();
00295   }
00296   gDetectorPulseMap.clear();
00297 }

00299 TTree* GetTree(TFile* inFile, const char* t_name)
00300 {
00301    TTree* InfoTree = (TTree *)inFile->Get(t_name);
00302    if(!InfoTree) {
00303       printf("Unable to find TTree '%s' in %s.\n",t_name,inFile->GetName());
00304       return NULL;
00305    }
00306    InfoTree->Print();
00307 
00308    return InfoTree;
00309 }
00310 
00311 TSetupData* TSetupData::Instance()
00312 {
00313   static TSetupData *s_data=NULL;
00314 
00315   // if s_data is already setup then we can just return it immediately
00316   if(s_data) return s_data;
00317 
00318   // Check we have a valid tree for the setup data
00319   TTree* setupTree= GetTree(gInFile, "SetupTree");
00320   if(!setupTree) return NULL;
00321 
00322   // Hook up the branch in the file to s_data and load in the data
00323   setupTree->SetBranchAddress("Setup",&s_data);
00324   if(!s_data) {
00325      printf("Unable to find TSetupData branch 'Setup' in the file");
00326      return NULL;
00327   }
00328   setupTree->GetEntry(0);
00329 
00330   return s_data;
00331 }
00332 
00333 void PrintSetupData(TSetupData* s_data){
00334      if(!s_data) return;
00335   // print things out
00336   std::map<std::string, std::string>::iterator it_info;
00337   printf("### TSetupData ###\n");
00338   printf("Bank  Detector Name  Clock Tick (ns)  Pedestal (ADC)  Trigger Polarity  Time Shift (ns)  No. of Bits\n");
00339   printf("----  -------------  ---------------  --------------  ----------------  ---------------  -----------\n");
00340   for (it_info=s_data->fBankToDetectorMap.begin();it_info!=s_data->fBankToDetectorMap.end();++it_info){
00341                  std::string bankname = it_info->first;
00342                  std::string detname = s_data->GetDetectorName(bankname);
00343                  float clockTick = s_data->GetClockTick(bankname);
00344                  int pedestal = s_data->GetPedestal(bankname);
00345                  int trig_pol = s_data->GetTriggerPolarity(bankname);
00346                  double time_shift = s_data->GetTimeShift(bankname);
00347                  int n_bits = s_data->GetNBits(bankname);
00348                  printf("%s  %s\t\t%f\t%d\t\t%d\t\t%f\t\t%d\n",bankname.c_str(), detname.c_str(), clockTick, pedestal, trig_pol, time_shift,n_bits);
00349   }
00350 }

00352 Int_t PrepareAnalysedPulseMap(TFile* fileOut){
00353         // TAnalysedMapWrapper
00354    gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper = new TAnalysedPulseMapWrapper(gAnalysedPulseMap);
00355 
00356    int split = 1;
00357    int bufsize = 64000;
00358    Int_t branchstyle = 1;
00359 
00360    if (split < 0) {branchstyle = 0; split = -1-split;}
00361    TTree::SetBranchStyle(branchstyle);
00362 
00363    gAnalysedPulseTree = new TTree("AnalysedPulseTree", "AnalysedPulseTree");
00364    gAnalysedPulseTree->SetAutoSave(100000000);
00365    gAnalysedPulseTree->SetMaxVirtualSize(100000000);
00366    gAnalysedPulseBranch = gAnalysedPulseTree->Branch("AnalysedPulseMapWrapper", 
00367                                                      "TAnalysedPulseMapWrapper", &gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper, bufsize, split);
00368    gAnalysedPulseBranch->SetAutoDelete(kFALSE);
00369    return 0;
00370 }

00372 Int_t PrepareSingletonObjects(const ARGUMENTS&){
00373    // Set up the modules navigator
00374    if(!modules::navigator::Instance()) return 1;
00375 
00376    // Make sure the instance of TSetupData get's loaded 
00377    // (though in practice we can do this lazily)
00378    //TSetupData* s_data = TSetupData::Instance();
00379    if(!TSetupData::Instance()) return 2;
00380 
00381    return 0;
00382 }
